Our Story

On a night like any other, a girl and a boy began an adventure of a lifetime. Out with his boys, Rob came to Star Bar (a sacred establishment to many) to meet up with his friend, Peter, who was at a university event. There, he spotted a girl who looked a little (who is he kidding, a lot!) like the girl of his dreams. That girl was Christy (obviously). He tried to chat (got nowhere) and he even tried a goodbye hug when parting (only to be thwarted by her friend, Lina).

Upon stalking and adding her on Facebook, the pair chatted and chatted (and then she stalked him back). Seizing his moment, he forcefully said he was going to take her out (his pro-tip is 'don't ask') and she said okay (she thought it was just dinner with a new friend). On that first dinner-turned-date, he agreed to swap dishes with her when she changed her mind about the dish she ordered, while she challenged him to scull the disgusting cocktails they chose wrongly. And the rest was historyâ€¦

The Bird

Christy

  • Loves a good ab workout
  • Will tell you what you need to hear
  • Very thoughtful, responsible and caring
  • Scorpio on the inside, Scorpio on the outside
  • Loves meat but loves seafood even more, especially lobster

The Broom

Robinson

  • Weird sense of humour
  • Cares a lot about his family and friends
  • Totally a Cancer (emotion-driven and creative)
  • Loves volleyball, gaming and anime too much
  • Can program (i.e. made this website) and can spell at a Year 2 Level

The Ceremony

4:00 PM

Depena Reserve, Russell Ave, Dolls Point,
New South Wales, Australia

Ceremony is followed by photographs.
Light afternoon tea will be provided.

The Reception

6:00 PM to 11:00 PM

Georges River Sailing Club
Sanoni Avenue, Sandringham, New South Wales, Australia

There will be canapes and a three-course dinner, as well as music and dancing!

Getting There

Driving

Please park at the car park of Georges River 16ft Sailing Club. The ceremony location is just to the left as you exit the car park towards Peter Depena Reserve.

Georges River Sailing Club Courtesy Bus

An hourly courtesy bus is available from the Georges River Sailing Club for pick ups and drop offs (pick up is free but drop off is $3) within a 5 km radius, i.e. from Kogarah Station. The bus runs from 1 pm to 11 pm.

Please call 0410 424 408 to make your own arrangements, or see https://georgesriversailingclub.com.au/ for more information.

Public Transport

There are various buses from nearby stations with stops nearby. Please see https://transportnsw.info/trip/ to organise your trip.

RSVP

You can RVSP for multiple guests at a time here.
(Psss...You are more than welcomed to bring an additional guest along. The more the merrier! Please register them as a guest as well.)
